image.altText: A close-up of a G4S logo on a fluorescent yellow vest, with the words: justice prisoner transport.

props.synopsis: Prison staff responsibilities in the NT are set to be privatised further, with Department of Corrections employees told the duties performed by private security firm G4S will be expanded.

title.children: NT expands use of private prison guards to support packed watch houses

image.altText: A mum helping her young daughter use cutlery to eat a meal.

props.synopsis: The community is rallying around the family of a four-year-old girl who was killed by a falling palm tree in Darwin, with more than $94,000 donated so far to help navigate "this time of profound grief".

title.children: Community raises $94k after 4yo killed by falling tree in Darwin backyard

image.altText: Two people in defence uniforms, standing near a row of aircraft on a large ship.

props.synopsis: One of the British navy's two massive aircraft carriers has docked in Darwin, following the testing of missile rearming capability at the city's port.

title.children: Darwin's wartime capability tested as massive UK naval ship visits port

image.altText: A woman standing outside a police station, wearing a stern expression.

props.synopsis: The Northern Territory government is considering changing the law in an effort to drive down the costs of coronial inquests. But a lawyer from the Kumanjayi Walker probe says police used far more resources than the community.

title.children: NT government flags capping coronial spends after $8m Walker inquest

image.altText: A man in a face mask and glasses, with cameramen and journalist holding microphones standing nearby.

props.synopsis: A newspaper delivery driver who hit and then reversed over three people late at night has avoided time in prison for fleeing the crime scene.

title.children: Delivery driver escapes jail for double fatal hit-and-run in Darwin

image.altText: Four Indigenous leaders standing outside of Parliament.

props.synopsis: The Northern Territory's four Aboriginal land councils have issued a rare joint statement, accusing the NT government of ignoring the human rights of Aboriginal people.

title.children: 'So disgusting': NT land councils issue warning against territory government

image.altText: A tall fence with razor wire attached at the bottom and top. Blue sky and some jail buildings in the background.

props.synopsis: One of Australia's largest Aboriginal legal services is calling on the federal government to intervene in what it is calling an incarceration "crisis" in the Northern Territory.

title.children: Federal government urged to intervene in NT incarceration 'crisis'

image.altText: An LNG flare flames out from a stack.

props.synopsis: The International Court of Justice was unequivocal about the consequences for countries that make the climate crisis worse. As one of the world's biggest fossil fuel exporters, it puts Australia on notice.

title.children: World Court lights match under Australia's fossil fuel export industry

image.altText: A close up photo of Donald Trump speaking to reporters at a cabinet table.

props.synopsis: The US president also says that Emmanuel Macron's declaration that France will recognise a Palestinian state "doesn't change anything".

title.children: Trump says Hamas doesn't want Gaza ceasefire deal and will be 'hunted down'

image.altText: Anthony Albanese G7

props.synopsis: The reality of the situation on the ground in Gaza, and the spectre of children dying of malnutrition or starvation, sits at such extraordinary odds with the language of spokespeople for both the Netanyahu government and the IDF.

title.children: The reality in Gaza shows Israel is at risk of becoming a global pariah

image.altText: A drone shot of a truck in a rural road

props.synopsis: A huge convoy of hay-laden trucks is making its way across the Nullabor from Western Australia to drought-stricken South Australia in what one young volunteer describes as a "journey of hope".

title.children: Convoy of drought relief trucks snakes across the Nullarbor

image.altText: A screenshot of two people in an intimate embrace looking shocked

props.synopsis: Actor Gwyneth Paltrow has appeared in a promotional video for the company that became famous after two of its employees were caught in an alleged affair at her ex-husband's concert.

title.children: Paltrow becomes Astronomer's 'spokesperson' after Coldplay saga

image.altText: Four actresses dressed as their characters pose for the camera against a black backdrop.

props.synopsis: You have to assume that the writers cherish these characters as much as their legions of fans do — and yet they twist them into strange and ludicrous shapes.

title.children: Who are these women and what have you done to Sex and the City?

image.altText: parents holding a new born baby in a black and white photo

props.synopsis: Milli Evrard died in the arms of her parents six days after birth. Test results delivered months later revealed she had a rare condition which scans had failed to pick up.

title.children: Born with broken arms and legs, Milli died six days after birth

image.altText: A batter puts his hand up in a claw like a tiger and appears to growl.

props.synopsis: Tim David scores Australia's fastest-ever T20I century, with his unbeaten 102 powering his side to a series-clinching six-wicket win over the West Indies.

title.children: David's record-breaking ton leads Australia to Windies T20 series win

image.altText: people swimming in a natural swimming hole between boulders.

props.synopsis: Don't be fooled by the turquoise waters and bubbling streams — swimmers who ignore warnings at this popular Queensland tourism site risk being pulled into deadly subterranean caverns.

title.children: After 21 deaths at this tourism beauty spot, the community has had enough

image.altText: Jaegar O'Meara and Liam Baker have a bit of a scrap

props.synopsis: Gold Coast records its biggest ever QClash victory over Brisbane, while Fremantle and West Coast meet for a western derby. Follow all the action in our live blog.

title.children: Toby Greene cops one-match ban as Dockers lead Eagles in heated clash

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: GWS skipper Toby Greene facing one-match ban

image.altText: Nathan Cleary passes the ball as Jarome Luai defends.

props.synopsis: The Panthers and Tigers face off at Western Sydney Stadium after Gold Coast moved off the foot of the table with an unlikely victory over the high-flying Warriors. Follow live.

title.children: Panthers carving up Tigers after Titans score stunning upset

image.altText: British and Irish Lions supporters dressed as lions with face paint

props.synopsis: The Wallabies must win at the Melbourne Cricket Ground on Saturday night to keep the Test series against the British and Irish Lions alive. Here is what you need to know about the second Test.

title.children: Lions vs Wallabies: How to watch, what time is kick-off and who is playing?

image.altText: Alex de Minaur stretches to play a forehand

props.synopsis: Seventh seed Alex de Minaur joins Corentin Moutet and Ben Shelton in the final four of the Washington Open, as the semifinal line-up takes shape.

title.children: De Minaur powers through to Washington Open semifinals

image.altText: a dark clouds covers the skyline of birdsville in queensland

props.synopsis: There are multiple indications the record drought across southern Australia is finally loosening its grip.

title.children: Most widespread rain in two years for southern Australia, with more to come

image.altText: A top-down view of a classic black Citroen on a driveway.

props.synopsis: Nearly a decade after the final Australian-made car rolled out of a factory in South Australia, many people remember that Holdens and Fords were built here. But did you know Renaults, Ramblers and other foreign cars were also put together by Australian workers?

title.children: Back when even foreign luxury cars were Australian-made

image.altText: Jake and Callum Robinson stand next to each other and smile.

props.synopsis: A judge grants a delay until November but warns lawyers they will be fined if they are not prepared for the next hearing.

title.children: Defence to explore potential plea deal over Perth brothers killed in Mexico

image.altText: A boy leaps into the air with arms outstretched defending a shot for goal

props.synopsis: Teen netballer Allen Griechen has represented Australia at a junior level, but is about to age out of his local competition as it does not allow males over the age of 14.

title.children: At 193cm tall, 14-year-old Allen is a netball star on the rise

image.altText: Samar Miqdad smiles in front of candles, smiling at the camera.

props.synopsis: A non-for-profit organisation is helping refugee women like Samar get on their feet, amid what an expert is calling a national gap in support services for vulnerable multicultural people.

title.children: After her apartment was flattened, Samar is building a new life in Australia

image.altText: hulk hogan flexes while wearing red tights and a yellow tanktop

props.synopsis: Hulk Hogan's life of signature wrestling moves gave way to racist rants, lawsuits bankrolled by venture capitalists and shirt-tearing displays on the Republican campaign stage.

title.children: How Hulk Hogan went from wrestling icon to right-wing mouthpiece

image.altText: A man in a suit and tie and hat walking outside court surrounded by reporters.

props.synopsis: The conviction of former Liberal MP Gareth Ward on serious sexual offences should be curtains on his political career, but it might not be that simple.

title.children: An MP has been found guilty of serious sex crimes. What happens next?

image.altText: An entrance sign for ForestOne's Benalla manufacturing facility

props.synopsis: A north-east Victorian community raises concerns about the partial closure of ForestOne's manufacturing site in Benalla.

title.children: Major employer in Benalla scaling back operations as costs increase

image.altText: A pile of Australian and American money.

props.synopsis: The once almighty American dollar has been falling against almost every major currency ever since Donald Trump became the 47th US president.

title.children: Heading overseas? A strengthening Aussie dollar might not be good news

image.altText: A young woman hooked up to a machine in a hospital.

props.synopsis: Cancer diagnosis in young people is on the rise, but there are practical ways to support loved ones going through treatment.

title.children: $500 just on parking: The practical realities of a cancer diagnosis

image.altText: Man with red scarring on his face and wearing black shirt hugs taller man in black and white shirt, ambulance behind them.

props.synopsis: Three years after he suffered near-fatal burns, Andrew Gibson says he is ready to take back his life by travelling Australia but first wanted to thank his rescuers.

title.children: When Andrew was set alight, a passer-by and paramedic saved his life
